title: How to Make Sugar and Cinnamon Pastry Balls

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to whatever the biscuits say on the package.
Melt the butter in the microwave.
steps.description:
Pour it on the cookie sheet and spread it out. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/15\/Make-Sugar-and-Cinnamon-Pastry-Balls-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Sugar-and-Cinnamon-Pastry-Balls-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/15\/Make-Sugar-and-Cinnamon-Pastry-Balls-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Sugar-and-Cinnamon-Pastry-Balls-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Mix the cinnamon and sugar together in a bowl.
Break each piece of dough in thirds.
Roll each of the pieces into balls.
Cover each ball in the mix of cinnamon and sugar.
steps.description: Keep rolling them and shaking the bowl until they are completely covered.

steps.headline: Put the sugar and cinnamon covered balls of dough on the cookie sheet.
steps.description: Spread them out so that they don't connect in the process of baking.

steps.headline: Melt a little more butter.
steps.description: Layer the dough with just a little bit of the butter so that they brown.

steps.headline: Pop the dough ball into the oven.
steps.description: Read the package to see how long they will take to cook.

text:
Preheat the oven to whatever the biscuits say on the package. Melt the butter in the microwave. Pour it on the cookie sheet and spread it out. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/15\/Make-Sugar-and-Cinnamon-Pastry-Balls-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Sugar-and-Cinnamon-Pastry-Balls-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/15\/Make-Sugar-and-Cinnamon-Pastry-Balls-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Sugar-and-Cinnamon-Pastry-Balls-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Mix the cinnamon and sugar together in a bowl. Break each piece of dough in thirds. Roll each of the pieces into balls. Cover each ball in the mix of cinnamon and sugar. Keep rolling them and shaking the bowl until they are completely covered. Put the sugar and cinnamon covered balls of dough on the cookie sheet. Spread them out so that they don't connect in the process of baking. Melt a little more butter. Layer the dough with just a little bit of the butter so that they brown. Pop the dough ball into the oven. Read the package to see how long they will take to cook. Finished.
